summary: William Greaves graduated from Cambridge and then worked at the Royal Observatory Greenwich. He became Professor of Astronomy in Edinburgh. He worked on both theoretical and practical astronomy.

' family came from the west of England but were living in Barbados where his father, Eustace  C Greaves, was a doctor. William, who was his parents' only son, attended Lodge School, Barbados, from

to

Greaves was appointed Chief Assistant at the Royal Observatory, Greenwich, in
1924

1938

1938

1955

1926
